intro: Epicranthes barbata, commonly known as the bearded cranesbill, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, showy flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves that are often lobed or toothed, contributing to its ornamental value. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen that gives it a "bearded" appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
